title: Single slit - slit width for 600 nm laser beam

content.question: Light of wavelength <math alttext="600 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math> passes through a narrow opening and forms a diffraction pattern on a screen <math alttext="2.5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> away from the opening. The first minimum in the diffraction pattern is <math alttext="1.0 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math> from the middle of the central bright fringe. What is the width of the opening?

choices.label: <math alttext="4.0 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.5 times 10 raised to the negative 4 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="6.0 times 10 raised to the negative 5 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.4 times 10 raised to the negative 9 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.5 times 10 raised to the negative 4 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>
